Lizard, Fire

This creature resembles a wingless red dragon. Its scales are gray and dappled in red and brown along its back. Its underbelly is bright red and its eyes are black with yellow pupils.


Fire Lizard

CR 8

XP 4,800
N Huge magical beast (fire)
Init +0; Senses darkvision 60 ft., low-light vision; Perception +0
DEFENSE
AC 17, touch 8, flat-footed 17 (+9 natural, -2 size)
hp 105 (10d10+50)
Fort +12, Ref +7, Will +3
Immune fire
Weaknesses vulnerability to cold
OFFENSE
Spd 30 ft.
Melee bite +17 (2d6+8), 2 claws +16 (1d8+8)
Space 15 ft.; Reach 10 ft.
Special Attacks breath weapon (20 ft. cone, DC 22, 4d6 fire)
STATISTICS
Str 26, Dex 10, Con 21, Int 2, Wis 11, Cha 10
Base Atk +10; CMB +20; CMD 30 (34 vs. trip)
Feats Ability Focus (breath weapon), Cleave, Power Attack, Skill Focus (Stealth), Weapon Focus (bite)
Skills Stealth +11
ECOLOGY
Environment warm plains and underground
Organization solitary or pair
Treasure standard

Fire lizards are often called "false dragons." Despite their general resemblance to dragons, sages have as yet found no evidence of these creatures being in any way related to them. Fire lizards do not associate with or keep company with dragons. A fire lizard is averages 30 feet long but can grow to almost twice that size.

Fire lizards prefer to attack opponents with their claws and bite, though if outnumbered they resort to using their breath weapon.
